noun.description: Conformity in the application of something, typically that which is necessary for the sake of logic, accuracy, or fairness.
examples: the grading system is to be streamlined to ensure greater consistency

noun.description: The way in which a substance, typically a liquid, holds together; thickness or viscosity.
examples: the sauce has the consistency of creamed butter

origin: Late 16th century (denoting permanence of form): from late Latin consistentia, from consistent- standing firm (see consistent).
